ch.zhaw.swen1.iotdisplay.platform

Interface RgbPixelScreen

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, RgbPixelRectangle

    public interface RgbPixelScreen
extends RgbPixelRectangle, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Extends RgbPixelRectangle by providing methods to set the pixel value.
    Author:
    fer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this screen and makes all changes visible
      RgbIntColor getRgbPixel(int x, int y)
      Returns the specified pixel
      void popClippingRectangle()
      Pops a previously pushed clipping rectangle from the stack.
      void setClippingRectangle(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Sets the clipping rectangle and pushes the current clipping rectangle on the stack.
      void setRgbPixel(int x, int y, RgbIntColor color)
      Sets the color of the specified pixel

      • Methods inherited from interface ch.zhaw.swen1.iotdisplay.platform.RgbPixelRectangle

        getColorComponentRange, getHeight, getWidth

    • Method Detail

      • setRgbPixel

        void setRgbPixel(int x,
                 int y,
                 RgbIntColor color)
        Sets the color of the specified pixel
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the pixel
        y - coordinate of the pixel
        color - color information. Each component must be greater than 0 and less than getColorComponentRange().

      • getRgbPixel

        RgbIntColor getRgbPixel(int x,
                        int y)
        Returns the specified pixel
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the pixel
        y - coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the color of the pixel at the specified location.

      • setClippingRectangle

        void setClippingRectangle(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Sets the clipping rectangle and pushes the current clipping rectangle on the stack. Pixels are only drawn if they belong to the clipping rectangle but all others are ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the clipping rectangle
        y - coordinate of the clipping rectangle
        width - of the clipping rectangle
        height - of the clipping rectangle

      • popClippingRectangle

        void popClippingRectangle()
        Pops a previously pushed clipping rectangle from the stack. If the stack is empty, nothing happens.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes this screen and makes all changes visible
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
